data.title: Get Current Census Data for Leicester, MA
data.meta_description: Need Leicester demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Leicester, MA from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 11,066 people, Leicester is the 174th most populated city in the state of Massachusetts out of 351 cities. But watch out, Leicester, because Maynard with 10,604 people and Acushnet with 10,602 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Leicester racial/ethnic groups are White (88.2%) followed by Hispanic (4.0%) and Black (3.7%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Leicester households was $93,885. Leicester households made slightly more than Methuen Town households ($93,681) and Milford households ($92,843) . However, 3.8% of Leicester families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Leicester residents is 42.4 years young.
